info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:10PM CDT until June 22 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS Huntsville AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Alabama, including the following counties, Limestone and Madison.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 807 PM CDT, the public reported continued runoff and flooded roads due to heavy rain from thunderstorms. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell from the storms this afternoon, but no further rainfall is expected this evening for Limestone and Madison Counties. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntsville, Madison, Meridianville, Moores Mill, Redstone Arsenal, Hazel Green, Harvest, University Of Alabama In Huntsville, Alabama A And M University, Marshall Space Flight Center, Toney, Capshaw, Farley and Holland Gin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
